Prime your cauldron, Sophie Neuenmuller. With the help of a very special reference book, you have in you such talent for alchemy that even the fabric of reality is yours to bend. But first, you must experiment. And for every experiment there's a mess. Where there's a mess, a scolding. Stay true to your goal of becoming an alchemist upon which others can rely, and in time, you will have the world at your feet. Eventually, even the gods themselves will pale before you!
Sophie Neuenmuller
Sophie Neuenmuller
Aaah, if only there was a way to suddenly get really good at alchemy.

Sophie began her journey as an alchemist under the tutelage of her grandmother. When her grandmother passed, Sophie was left with her atelier and only a rudimentary knowledge of the craft. At the outset of Atelier Sophie: The Alchemist of the Mysterious Book, Sophie accepts a simple synthesis request, which she records in a book that belonged to her late grandmother. This would soon wake the quiescent soul inhabiting the book.

The book, who goes by the name Plachta, possesses a keen understanding of alchemy, and takes Sophie under wing as apprentice. Throughout her game, Sophie is tasked with filling Plachta's pages with alchemical notes and recipes in order to restore its memory. Together, they work toward Sophie's dream of becoming an alchemist upon which others can rely.
